title: SB 1325
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. The department reviews and approves plans submitted under Section 25246 of the Health and Safety Code if they comply with regulations and state/federal laws. Approval is contingent on compliance with Water Code Section 13227. The plan for an interim status facility must be approved within 60 days of submission to the department, as per Water Code Section 13227. Immediate approval may be granted by the director if it is deemed necessary to protect public health, safety, or the environment. Any department action taken under this section is subject to Section 25204.5. The department must impose hazardous waste facility postclosure plan requirements on owners or operators through enforcement orders, agreements, or permits, in compliance with the California Environmental Quality Act. Before approving or modifying a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan, the department must allow public involvement, including notice and comment opportunities. The department determines if a modification is significant based on class 3 permit criteria. Public concern is also considered in this determination. The department considers public concern and the complexity of a proposed modification to determine if it requires a class 3 permit modification. The department has the authority to order necessary actions at a facility to protect public health and safety, regardless of permit modifications. If the department issues a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan through an enforcement order or agreement, the owner must pay specified fees and comply with regulations during the postclosure period. The postclosure period begins on the effective date of the postclosure permit, enforcement order, or enforceable agreement. The department may enforce a postclosure plan through actions such as filing an injunction, requiring corrective action, and assessing civil penalties for violations. The department may enforce a postclosure plan through actions such as filing an injunction, requiring corrective action, and assessing civil penalties for violations. Subdivision (d) does not apply to postclosure plans with permits issued before December 31, 2003, unless mutually replaced with an enforcement order or agreement. Regulations for postclosure plan requirements must be adopted by the department by January 1, 2018. The department may issue a postclosure permit to enforce a postclosure plan if necessary. This does not limit the department's authority to order actions to protect public health, safety, or the environment. Section 25247 of the Health and Safety Code is amended. Section 1.5 of the bill includes amendments to the Health and Safety Code, contingent on the enactment of other related bills by January 1, 2017. Senate Bill 839 will only be in effect until the new operative date of this bill, with Section 1.5 becoming operative at that time, while Section 1 will not be in effect.
